intro: Cienfuegosia pedata, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. Cienfuegosia pedata is an important species for both ecological and ornamental purposes in its native habitat.
